content.title: インド警察が「牛監視員」殺害で怒り - アルジャジーラ日本語
content.desc: The killing of a police officer by so-called cow vigilantes, belonging to far-right Hindu groups, has triggered outrage in India. Local media reported on Wednesday that Yogesh Raj, the main suspect behind the violence, is absconding and remains to be arrested. Inspector Subodh Kumar Singh was killed on Monday when villagers, many of them members of far-right Hindu groups, clashed with police in Uttar Pradesh state's Bulandshahr district, about 100km from the Indian capital, New Delhi. The villagers were protesting the alleged inability of police in Chingrawathi village to stop cow slaughter...
